item.title: 中国扣留投资银行家并收走护照
item.description: 中国正在加大对其 8700 名投资银行家大军的打击力度。【原文：China is turning up the heat on its army of 8,700 investment bankers.】

item.title: 日元走软，日经 225 指数上涨逾 3%，止住 7 天跌势
item.description: 由于日元升值暂停，科技公司和汽车制造商等出口商受到提振，日本股市上扬，日经 225 指数上涨超过 3%。【原文：Japanese stocks advanced, with the Nikkei 225 Stock Average gaining more than 3%, as a pause in the yen’s strengthening gave a boost to exporters such as technology companies and automakers.】

item.title: 谷歌在反垄断打击前几乎削减广告交易费用
item.description: 在美国司法部的反垄断审判中，谷歌前高管作证说，八年前，在网站开发出一种绕过谷歌工具提高在线广告收入的方法后，谷歌曾讨论过削减其广告交易费用。【原文：Eight years ago, Google debated slashing the fees for its advertising exchange — the highest in the industry — after websites developed a way to boost online ad revenue while bypassing the company’s tools, former executives testified as part of a US Justice Department antitrust trial.】

item.title: 红海危机导致运价飙升，亚洲成为赢家和输家
item.description: 亚洲上半年的盈利情况表明，红海危机的连锁反应将继续使生产出口产品的公司付出高昂的代价，而运输产品的公司则从运费上涨中获益。【原文：First-half earnings in Asia showed how the ripple effects of the Red Sea crisis will continue to be costly for companies that make goods for export, while those that transport their wares benefit from higher freight rates.】

item.title: 紧缩之墙扼杀中国扩大需求的努力
item.description: 随着中国经济增长目标所面临的威胁与日俱增，北京的财政部门负责人正在测试通过鼓励需求来提振经济的新方法，以打破长期以来的惯例。【原文：Finance chiefs in Beijing are testing new ways to boost the economy by encouraging demand, breaking with long-established practice as threats to the country’s growth target mount.】

item.title: 通胀数据浇灭美联储大幅减息的希望，黄金保持跌势
item.description: 一份报告显示，8 月份美国基本通胀率回升，削弱了对美联储下周大幅降息的预期。【原文：Gold steadied after a small decline following a report that showed underlying US inflation picked up in August, weakening expectations for an outsized interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve next week.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好科技股拉动大盘。债券市场结束了对美联储大幅降息的幻想。争购英伟达（Nvidia）芯片让一些客户感到沮丧。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Tech stocks lift the broader market. Bond market ends flirtation with big Fed rate cut. The scramble for Nvidia chips has left some customers frustrated. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 飓风 "弗朗辛 "引发担忧，原油涨后趋稳
item.description: 由于飓风 "弗朗辛 "袭击了墨西哥湾的主要原油产区，石油价格在创下两周多来的最大涨幅后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after the biggest gain in more than two weeks as Hurricane Francine hit key crude-producing regions in the Gulf of Mexico.】

item.title: 全球资金涌入东南亚股市，美联储中枢发挥作用
item.description: 东南亚股票已巩固了其作为资金经理们为美联储政策中枢定位的最爱的投资品种的地位。【原文：Southeast Asian equities have cemented their position as a favorite play of money managers positioning for the Federal Reserve’s policy pivot.】

item.title: 中国火锅连锁店计划向美国扩张，以摆脱国内市场的低迷
item.description: 中国火锅连锁店海底捞表示，未来几年将重点进一步拓展国外成熟市场，尤其是美国市场，努力在国内食客减少消费的情况下吸引新顾客。【原文：Chinese hot pot chain Haidilao said it will focus on expanding further into established foreign markets in the coming years, notably the US, working to draw new customers as diners at home pull back on spending.】

item.title: 交易员对美联储减息立场坚定，亚洲股市将上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在科技股反弹提振华尔街之后，亚洲股市早盘上涨，交易商将目光从美国核心通胀率的上升转向下周即将实施的降息。【原文：Stocks in Asia were headed for early gains after a tech rally lifted Wall Street as traders looked beyond elevated core US inflation to imminent rate cuts next week.】

item.title: 压裂为何仍是争议的 "避雷针
item.description: 美国副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）在竞选白宫总统时改变了对水力压裂法的立场，这使水力压裂法再次成为公众关注的焦点。这项开创性的油气开采技术使美国实现了能源独立，但多年来一直是争议的导火索。许多环保主义者因其对水、碳排放和地震的影响而反对它，而支持者则认为它是美国经济发展的关键。【原文：Hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, has been thrust back into the public spotlight as Vice President Kamala Harris’ change of position on it comes under scrutiny given her campaign for the White House. The groundbreaking technique for oil and gas extraction that vaulted the US to energy independence has for years been a lightning rod for controversy. Many environmentalists oppose it because of its impact on water, carbon emissions and earthquakes, while proponents defend it as key to the US econo】

item.title: SpaceX 的小对手飙升 1300%。现在是卫星发射
item.description: AST SpaceMobile 公司是一家希望与太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）竞争的小型电信公司，在短短六个月内从 2 美元飙升至 28 美元，成为今年全球最热门的股票之一。【原文：AST SpaceMobile Inc., the tiny telecom company that wants to compete with SpaceX, has become one of the hottest stocks in the world this year after soaring from $2 to $28 in just six months.】

item.title: 银行为 Janney 的收购定价 14 亿美元杠杆贷款
item.description: 在交易条款收紧后，周三定价的 14 亿美元杠杆贷款方案将为 KKR & Co.收购资金管理公司 Janney Montgomery Scott 提供资金。【原文：A $1.4 billion leveraged-loan package priced Wednesday to help fund KKR & Co.’s buyout of money manager Janney Montgomery Scott, after terms on the deal were tightened.】

item.title: 英特尔在经历了漫长而痛苦的衰落之后，只有糟糕的选择
item.description:
首席执行官帕特-格尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）计划让这家芯片制造商重新焕发活力，但这一计划已接近尾声。【原文：

CEO Pat Gelsinger’s plan to spend the chipmaker back to relevance nears the end of its runway.

】

item.title: 经济学家称泰国新总理的改革蓝图缺乏具体内容
item.description: 泰国新任总理制定了一份路线图，以解决从接近历史最高水平的家庭债务到不温不火的经济增长和老龄化社会等最紧迫的问题。但据经济学家称，该计划缺乏能确保在规定时间内取得成果的细节。【原文：Thailand’s new prime minister has a roadmap to deal with the most pressing issues ranging from a near-record household debt to a tepid growth rate and an aging society. But the plan is short on details that would ensure time-bound outcomes, according to economists.】

item.title: 95 万亿美元 ETF 市场风险部分闪现看跌信号
item.description: 价值 9.5 万亿美元的 ETF 市场正出现越来越多的不景气迹象，有可能暴露出周三的股市下跌买盘只是交易员从投机交易工具中套现的假象。【原文：Signs of gloom are mounting in the $9.5 trillion ETF landscape, threatening to expose Wednesday’s dip buying in stocks as a head-fake with traders cashing out of speculative trading vehicles.】

item.title: 债券和股票暴跌，MultiPlan 与部分持有人进行债务谈判
item.description: MultiPlan 公司表示，它正在与一些债务持有人商谈资本结构改革事宜，此举可能会导致一些投资者蒙受损失。【原文：MultiPlan Corp. said it is talking with some debtholders about revamping its capital structure, a move which could result in losses for some investors.】

item.title: 红杉认为人工智能软件比模型更赚钱
item.description:
该公司对人工智能软件制造商的投资超过了对 OpenAI 等基础模型 创建者的投资。【原文：

The firm is investing more in makers of AI software than creators of foundational models like OpenAI.

】

item.title: Adobe、Nvidia、Autodesk 打造制作 3D 视觉效果的人工智能工具
item.description:
科技公司正在努力研究如何获取正确的数据来构建新型人工智能工具。【原文：

Tech companies are grappling with how to get the right data to build a new type of artificial intelligence tool. 

】

item.title: 走韩国的路，中国就能避免日本失去的几十年
item.description:
为了建设创新型经济，北京的决策者们正在效仿首尔的同行。【原文：

To build an innovation economy, policymakers in Beijing are emulating their peers in Seoul.

】

item.title: OpenAI 募集资金将使初创公司价值增至 1500 亿美元
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，OpenAI 正在洽谈以 1500 亿美元的估值向投资者融资 65 亿美元。【原文：OpenAI is in talks to raise $6.5 billion from investors at a valuation of $150 billion, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 比特币开采难度创纪录，利润率面临压力
item.description: 随着制造加密货币的公司之间竞争的加剧，一项衡量比特币挖矿难度的行业指标攀升至历史新高。【原文：An industry metric of how challenging it is to mine Bitcoin climbed to a record high with competition intensifying among the companies that mint the cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行为 Envestnet 杠杆收购提供 17.6 亿美元贷款
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行资本市场（RBC Capital Markets）推出了一笔 17.6 亿美元的杠杆贷款，为计划收购财富管理软件公司 Envestnet Inc.【原文：RBC Capital Markets launched a $1.76 billion leveraged loan to help fund the planned buyout of wealth-management software company Envestnet Inc.】

item.title: Blackstone 财务总监 Chae 称美国通胀 "处于目标位置
item.description: 黑石集团（Blackstone Inc.首席财务官 Michael Chae 表示，该公司 "对软着陆持谨慎乐观态度"，这表明这家另类资产管理公司押注美联储抑制通胀的努力不会引发美国经济衰退。【原文：Blackstone Inc. Chief Financial Officer Michael Chae said the firm is “cautiously optimistic about a soft landing,” signaling the alternative asset manager is betting the Federal Reserve’s efforts to tamp down inflation won’t trigger a US recession.】

item.title: 资产管理公司现在开始投资一度被回避的核电股票
item.description: 基金经理们打赌，核能这个传统上不被具有环保使命的投资者所涉足的领域将卷土重来。【原文：Fund managers are betting that nuclear energy, an area traditionally off-bounds for investors with environmental mandates, is set to make a comeback.】

item.title: 帕尔默广场资本将推出两只购买 CLO 的 ETF
item.description: 帕尔默广场资本管理公司（Palmer Square Capital Management）将推出一对交易所交易基金，用于购买抵押贷款债务和其他资产，随着投资者进入证券化信贷市场的渠道不断扩大，此类融资工具也在近期激增。【原文：Palmer Square Capital Management is launching a pair of exchange-traded funds that will buy collateralized loan obligations and other assets, adding to a recent proliferation of such financing vehicles as investor access to securitized credit markets expands.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德公司因卡尼与特鲁多的关系而承受政治压力
item.description: 加拿大保守党领袖、目前最有希望赢得下届大选的皮埃尔-波利瓦尔（Pierre Poilievre）抨击前央行行长马克-卡尼同意在经济政策上帮助贾斯汀-特鲁多。【原文：Pierre Poilievre, the leader of Canada’s Conservative Party and the current favorite to win the next election, attacked former central banker Mark Carney for agreeing to help Justin Trudeau on economic policy.】

item.title: 赞比亚希望世界银行在年底前为旱灾提供巨灾基金
item.description: 赞比亚已要求世界银行将现有的一项资助计划提前，以帮助应对历史性干旱带来的后果，并在年底前批准一项新的灾难融资额度。【原文：Zambia has asked the World Bank to front-load an existing funding program to help deal with the fallout of an historic drought, and approve a new catastrophe financing line by year-end.】

item.title: 激进股东抨击 Dye & Durham M&A 战略
item.description: 一位激进股东将矛头指向加拿大软件公司 Dye & Durham Ltd. 进行更多并购的决定，要求独立董事 "停止诡计"，并尽快召开特别会议。【原文：An activist shareholder is taking aim at Canadian software firm Dye & Durham Ltd.’s decision to pursue more mergers and acquisitions, demanding independent directors “stop the shenanigans” and call a special meeting as soon as possible.】
